title: Why did you take away true sight for some champions but not all?
body: {{champion:96}}{{champion:43}}  {{champion:76}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:117}} Can no longer reveal stealthed units with their respective abilities but {{champion:51}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:4}}  and most likely a few others I can't think of still can. Lee Sin's makes sense thematically, but why take the rest of them away if you're not going to take all of them away?

replies.body: Same reason why Fizz's Q became 'dodgeable' when they removed J4's ulti 'dodgeability'. You know, when you flash out of the animation, it didn't do damage, now J4's always does damage and Fizz's won't do damage if you flash out of it.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PFZzZiJN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-04-12T17:53:16.889+0000)
>
> Same reason why Fizz's Q became 'dodgeable' when they removed J4's ulti 'dodgeability'. You know, when you flash out of the animation, it didn't do damage, now J4's always does damage and Fizz's won't do damage if you flash out of it.

That has absolutely nothing to do with what the OP is about. And for the record, Poppy's E is also dodgeable by using any type of dash when she uses it. Damage and all, not just the knockback.

He asked why other champions can't do X because others do X. I gave an example of the same principle in use. Those champions can't reveal stealth anymore, but the others can. Fizz can't hit a target who flashes anymore, but J4 can.
